This is especially for the newbies. So whosoever is doubtful as to where to start from, this is the place.
We are very happy that you registered and we welcome you to IIST's fest conscientia. Thus we have created a problem named "welcome to conscientia." After solving this problem, we hope that you'll feel very welcome. 

If you read the previous paragraph, you're probably wondering why it's there. But if you read it very carefully, you might notice that the phrase "welcome to conscientia" is present several times: 51634 times in total. After all, it's easy to look through the paragraph and find a 'w'; then find an 'e' later in the paragraph; then find an 'l' after that, and so on. Your task is to write a program that can take any text and print out how many times that text contains the phrase "welcome to conscientia".


Input Format
The first line will contain the number of test cases, t. For each test case, a single line contains a string with a maximum length of 200 characters
t â‰¤ 15


Output Format
The number of times the phrase "welcome to conscientia" excluding the quotes has occurred.



Sample Input:
2
welcome to conscientia
wellccome too ccoonscienntia

Sample Output:
1
64
